intro: Dianthus integer subsp. integer, commonly known as the narrow-leaved campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. It is a perennial species that prefers full sun and well-drained conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
